intro: Icica rufa, commonly known as the red icica, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red flowers and hairy, broad leaves. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
